intro: Lamprotis flagelliformis, commonly known as the whip-like liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its elongated, ribbon-like leaves that give it its common name. This species typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Lamprotis flagelliformis plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
